Research

My research spans multiple areas of computer science with a focus on developing intelligent systems that are both powerful and responsible. I'm particularly interested in the intersection of machine learning, ethics, and sustainability.

Research Areas

Explainable Artificial Intelligence

Developing methods to make AI decision-making processes transparent and interpretable. This work is crucial for high-stakes applications like healthcare and autonomous systems where understanding the "why" behind AI decisions is as important as accuracy.

Key Publications: 8 papers • Funding: $200K NSF Grant

Sustainable Computing

Researching energy-efficient algorithms and green computing practices to reduce the environmental impact of AI systems. Our recent work on neural network pruning techniques has shown promising results in reducing computational costs while maintaining performance.

Key Publications: 5 papers • Impact: 40% energy reduction

Human-AI Collaboration

Investigating how humans and AI systems can work together most effectively. This includes studying trust in AI systems, designing intuitive interfaces, and developing frameworks for productive human-machine partnerships.

Key Publications: 12 papers • Collaborators: 6 institutions

AI Ethics & Fairness

Addressing bias, fairness, and ethical considerations in machine learning systems. Our work focuses on developing algorithmic solutions to ensure equitable outcomes across diverse populations and use cases.

Key Publications: 6 papers • Citations: 1,200+

Current Projects

EcoAI: Energy-Efficient Deep Learning

NSF Grant • 2024-2027 • $150,000

This project aims to develop novel neural network architectures that maintain high performance while drastically reducing energy consumption. We're exploring dynamic network pruning, knowledge distillation, and hardware-software co-design approaches.

Team: 2 PhD students, 3 MS students, 1 postdoc

TrustML: Building Interpretable Healthcare AI

Industry Partnership • 2023-2025 • $75,000

In collaboration with Regional Medical Center, we're developing explainable AI tools for medical diagnosis. The system not only provides predictions but also explanations that doctors can understand and trust.

Partners: Regional Medical Center, DataHealth Inc.

FairLearn: Bias Detection and Mitigation

University Internal Grant • 2023-2024 • $25,000

Developing automated tools to detect and mitigate bias in machine learning pipelines. Our approach combines statistical methods with causal inference to ensure fair outcomes across different demographic groups.

Applications: Hiring systems, loan approval, criminal justice

Selected Publications

Energy-Efficient Neural Networks via Dynamic Pruning

Authors: J. Smith, A. Johnson, M. Lee
Venue: International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML) 2024
Status: Best Paper Award

We propose a novel dynamic pruning technique that reduces neural network energy consumption by 40% while maintaining 99% of original accuracy. The method adapts the network structure during inference based on input complexity.

Impact: 127 citations • Featured in MIT Technology Review

Explainable AI in Healthcare: A Comprehensive Survey

Authors: J. Smith, R. Patel, S. Chen, K. Williams
Venue: Nature Machine Intelligence 2023
Type: Survey Paper

This comprehensive survey analyzes 200+ papers on explainable AI in healthcare, identifying key challenges and future research directions. We provide a taxonomy of explanation methods and evaluate their effectiveness in clinical settings.

Impact: 89 citations • Downloaded 2,500+ times

Human-AI Trust: Factors Affecting Acceptance in Autonomous Systems

Authors: M. Rodriguez, J. Smith, L. Thompson
Venue: ACM Transactions on Computer-Human Interaction 2023
Type: Journal Article

Through a series of user studies with 500+ participants, we identified key factors that influence human trust in autonomous AI systems. Our findings inform the design of more trustworthy AI interfaces.

Impact: 156 citations • Policy implications for autonomous vehicles

Fairness-Aware Machine Learning: Algorithms and Applications

Authors: J. Smith, D. Kumar, A. Singh
Venue: AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence 2022
Type: Conference Paper

We introduce a framework for incorporating fairness constraints into machine learning algorithms without significantly compromising performance. The approach is validated on real-world datasets from hiring and lending domains.

Impact: 203 citations • Implemented in 3 industry systems

Research Tools & Resources

Open Source Projects

EcoML Toolkit - A Python library for energy-efficient machine learning with 500+ GitHub stars

ExplainAI Framework - Tools for generating explanations for deep learning models

Datasets

FairHire Dataset - Anonymized hiring data for bias detection research (10K records)

EnergyML Benchmark - Standardized benchmark for evaluating energy-efficient ML models

Available for research use under CC BY-NC 4.0 license

Educational Materials

Interactive tutorials on explainable AI concepts

Lecture slides and assignments for sustainable computing courses

Used by 20+ universities worldwide

Interested in Collaboration?

I'm always looking for opportunities to collaborate with fellow researchers, industry partners, and students who share similar interests. Whether you're interested in joint research projects, visiting our lab, or exploring funding opportunities, I'd love to hear from you.
